document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic review of the genus Eoophyla Swinhoe, 1900 (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Acentropinae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic review of the genus Eoophyla Swinhoe, 1900 (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Acentropinae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Aulacodes sinensis Hampson, 1897
, Trans. Ent. Soc. Lond. , 1897: 176; Wang, 1980 ,
Economic Insect Fauna of China
, 21: 110; Wang, 1981, Iconocraphia Heterocerorum Sinicorum , I: 68. Type-locality: Mt. Emei, China .

Eoophyla sinensis : Speidel, 1984
, Neue ent. Nachr. , 12: 37; Yoshiyasu, 1987 , Microlep. Thai. , 1: 172; Speidel & Mey, 1999a, Tijds. v. Ent. , 142: 130; Li, You & Wang, 2003, Acta Zootaxonomica Sinica , 28(2): 300.

Diagnosis. The species is widely distributed in China . It can be distinguished from others by the forewing of male has its upper edge of cell diffused with fuscous long setae from base to 2/3 section and androconial hairs covered with apical 1/3 of the cell from the upper edge. In male genitalia, it is different by its strong specialized setae about 3/4 length of valva, first and second setae without obvious expanding, third seta with minute spines laterally and a knife-shaped apex. In female genitalia, it is different by its signa about 3/4 length of corpus bursae.
